item.title: cot θ = cos θ/sin θ
item.description:
To prove that \(\cot \theta = \frac{\cos \theta}{\sin \theta}\), let’s follow these easy-to-understand steps:

Step 1: Understand the Definition of Cotangent

Cotangent, often written as \(\cot \theta\), is one of the reciprocal trigonometric functions. It is defined as:

\[ \cot \theta = \frac{1}{\tan \theta} \]

Step 2: Recall the Definition of Tangent

Tangent (\(\tan \theta\)) is another trigonometric function and is also known to be the ratio of cosine (\(\cos \theta\)) to sine (\(\sin \theta\)). Specifically:

item.title: tan θ = sin θ/cos θ
item.description:
Step-by-Step Explanation and Proof

  1. Understand the Definitions:

    • Consider a right triangle with an acute angle θ.
    • In such a triangle:
      • The opposite side is labeled as \( \text{opp} \).
      • The adjacent side is labeled as \( \text{adj} \).
      • The hypotenuse is labeled as \( \text{hyp} \).

  2. Express Sine and Cosine:

    • By definition:
      • \(\sin{\theta} = \frac{\text{opp}}{\text{hyp}}\)
      • \(\cos{\theta} = \frac{\text{adj}}{\text{hyp}}\)

  3. Form the Ratio for Tangent:

    • The tangent of an angle in a right triangle is defined as: \[ \tan{\theta} = \frac{\sin{\theta}}{\cos{\theta}} \]
  4. \[ \tan{\theta} = \frac{\frac{\text{opp}}{\text{hyp}}}{\frac{\text{adj}}{\text{hyp}}} = \frac{\text{opp}}{\text{hyp}} \times \frac{\text{hyp}}{\text{adj}} = \frac{\text{opp}}{\text{adj}} \]
